content.label: Fun, but overpriced. Stops being fun when all progress is randomly reset.

title.label: Game reset after hours of play

content.label: I was enjoying it... played for a few hours before (with cell signal) and during a flight.    Opened later when I had cell signal and all my progress was lost... very annoying

This game is good, almost great. 
It‚Äôs execution is near flawless.
The game moves brilliantly.
The sounds effects are fabulous. 
The idea is pretty original. 
I just need more.
It was over way too early. And I realize it doesn‚Äôt ever really end, there‚Äôs just isn‚Äôt much to bring me back to the blackhole. 

Maybe an update with a few more maps?
Please?
I got the game yesterday and played it for at least an hour then came back to it today and my progress was gone. Not motivated to start it over but it was fun while it lasted I guess.

title.label: Was fun, but a bug killed my progress

content.label: I had a good time playing this game, and unlocked every upgrade and the ‚ÄúBlack Hole‚Äù level. Unfortunately, one day I launched the app and all of my progress was lost. The game started like I had never played it before. Pretty big bummer.
It seems like once you stop playing for a bit, it erases all your progress, returning to first leve with no upgrades. Got bored of restarting whole thing.
My save was just totally wiped - no I definitely did not enable save reset

Great game and a great idea and theme for a game, but it‚Äôs way too short and has no replay value and incredibly lazy and boring level design. If you‚Äôve never played the new style of aim and shoot brick breakers like the millions of free ones on the App Store, you will probably think this game is a blast to play, but if you played those kind of games a bunch, you might be pretty disappointed.

This is hands down a 5 Star game for the first 2 hours or so. After that, you‚Äôve essentially beaten it. The final level is an endless blackhole....which is fun and all, but by the time you get to it, you can no longer upgrade your starting shots to actually compete. Eventually you‚Äôll just run across a puzzle piece that is numerically impossible to defeat. 

For the full price of this game there needs to be more levels, more shapes, more
Upgrades....more something.

Really fun game, but once you‚Äôve beaten the handful of worlds there are available, and maxed out the power-ups, there isn‚Äôt much reason to come back. After a week or two of play, there‚Äôs no reason to revisit this.
Please add the ability to mute sounds.

I don‚Äôt know if there‚Äôs an issue with my phone but there‚Äôs no way to turn off the sound effects. The music can be switched off but not the effects it‚Äôs incredibly annoying when trying to listen to a podcast while playing.
There is some subtle ways to master this game. Learning just exactly what to do and watch as the blocks fall away, is very rewarding . The, uh, white noodle ghost is fun too.

title.label: WHY IS IT MAKING PREDATOR NOISES AT ME IM SOOOOO AFRAID

content.label: Neat but limited. Would benefit greatly from designed levels instead of randomly generated ones.

title.label: Game resets and can‚Äôt be recovered

content.label: The game is fun enough, but will reset randomly and lose all progress/high scores.

Starts off strong but after maybe 30 minutes to an hour the fun ends. With the levels being Procedurally Generated I‚Äôm really surprised at how few levels there are. 

At the start you have limited balls and shots but with a few upgrades you get unlimited shots which really kills the challenge. Then you get to a point where the crystals you collect to buy upgrades become pointless because you maxed out everything.

I would like to see more block shapes that cause the balls to bounce differently or black holes or gravity spots that pull or push the balls different directions (goes with space theme) adding to the difficulty.

The game has some charm, the sound effects and music are very good. There‚Äôs a real satisfaction when you get those balls bouncing around and the upgrade mechanics keep it fresh for a bit longer. Not without its quirks and flaws here and there, but I thoroughly enjoyed it.

This game has a few well constructed levels, which are fun enough. Once you beat them, though, the game unlocks an "endless" mode, which is presumably meant to be the primary method of play. 

This mode is essentially broken, and was pretty clearly added as a hasty afterthought. The randomly generated blocks will frequently put you in unwinnable situations, which can be frustrating if you don't like being penalized for things out of your control. 

Maybe the developer will address this flawed mode in the future. But as of this writing, I cannot recommend playing this game for more than the brief introductory levels.

title.label: 4 stars b/c it needs more levels

content.label: I have beaten this game twice and am restarting for a third time. Would have been 5 stars if it had more levels. Infinity mode loses appeal quickly.
A simple yet fun game that is easy to pick up and play. One of the best casual games on iOS.
Simple, charming gameplay with tons of careful finish and polish. I really enjoy playing even though ‚Äúfinishing‚Äù it might actually be impossible :)

Really satisfying feel to the gameplay. Could use more upgrades, more levels, more something. Maybe a challenge mode with blocks that have their own characteristics (flipping blocks on/off so the player has to time shots), or with balls that behave differently (arching maybe), or the board acts differently (moves up with time, not moves), or with a time limit.

Not sure why I can continue to catch crystals when I‚Äôm playing the endless level and have all the upgrades, wish there was something to still put those toward.

Really fun, was worth $4 to me, but I‚Äôd understand if someone were to say it was too much money for the experience.

Once you take it to the deep space ‚Äúinfinity‚Äù stage (obviously because they couldn‚Äôt come up with anymore planets) you get to enjoy 4-ball games because 90% of the time the game was over when it started. Not sure why they‚Äôre doing that. Obviously if you stuff the gap solid there won‚Äôt be many long games. 

My chief gripe at this point is that they need to give you an ‚Äúend game‚Äù button to hurry the inevitable a little. Disappointing. This game had so much potential. Don‚Äôt even bother with the ‚Äúinfinity‚Äù stage. There are no more achievements forthcoming.

Like everyone else, I think this is a great game, but it‚Äôs much too short. Once you get to the black hole, it gets very unsatisfying as the block numbers are so high, you can‚Äôt get very far before they overwhelm you. I hope they add more content in an update, otherwise the price is a bit high.

Fun game with simple but captivating gameplay. Rather short game, could use more levels or maybe an unlimited mode for each planet. Also needs a quit game or reset game option. But I like the game and recommend it.

I had a lot of fun in the beginning levels but once you reach the black hole there‚Äôs nothing left to do. The whole thing only took me a few hours to complete. I hope they add more planets or another feature to make it enjoyable again.
I enjoyed the game but once you reach the final stage it gets boring. Maybe some achievements or additional things to buy would help with longevity?

title.label: I want to enjoy the game, but I can‚Äôt.

content.label:
I find the game to be enjoyable, with a basic progression system.
You can ‚Äúbeat‚Äù the game within a few hours, bringing a question to the $4 price tag. The game has the bizarre design choice of having NO WAY to disable sounds which are incredibly annoying. With an iPhone, the sound will play through Bluetooth or analog connected speakers or headphones so this game isn‚Äôt playable if im listening to music or an audiobook. Such an enormous design flaw that I‚Äôd say this game isn‚Äôt worth it, especially not at the ridiculous price point.
Don‚Äôt listen to the usual reviewers who claim that $4 is somehow ‚Äútoo expensive‚Äù for this fun, carefully crafted, ad-free game. It‚Äôs great.

I‚Äôll admit, I didn‚Äôt love this game at first. I had to try it a few times, reluctantly. After beating the first level, I couldn‚Äôt put it down. I picked up some techniques like shooting at specific spots on the rounded edge and paying attention to the numbers to think about my strategy. At first I was shooting randomly and crashing often. I beat all the levels and was happily surprised by the black hole level. Brilliant! Got my whole family hooked on this game. I‚Äôm excited for future updates and improvements. The simplicity is a major draw, but it could be fun to have power-ups and other types of blocks, like maybe squared corners to make it more challenging or diamond shapes. Anyway, this is a SUPER fun game and I highly recommend it!!!

Way overpriced for what you get.
  The physics are fine and it‚Äôs polished, but there‚Äôs very very little advancement or upgrades; before you know it you‚Äôre on an endless, pointless level gaining gems to spend on nothing.
   I certainly hope they throw down a substantial update because 4 bucks for this...c‚Äômon man. 
BBTAN was a much better value and way more entertaining

If you like bouncers, you‚Äôll like this. The gameplay is great and I loved the idea of buying your power ups as you go to unlock new worlds. But after an hour or so of play you‚Äôve unlocked everything there is to unlock and the endless ‚Äúblack hole‚Äù level is basically pointless because the blocks start off too high to get very far and you can‚Äôt continue to buy the Starting Balls power up even though you‚Äôre still earning crystals. What‚Äôs the point of earning crystals forever if there is nothing left to buy to help you?

It‚Äôs a sad thing, when I finally find a fun mobile game that‚Äôs not gouging me for micro transactions but it‚Äôs about as long as a movie.  This game is maybe two hours long at most, if you get into he hang of how it‚Äôs made. After that, there‚Äôs no end reward or anything. Just a final ‚Äòinfinite mode‚Äô to waste time on.  Disappointing.

Really fun game but once you reach the last level it‚Äôs basically over without much incentive to keep playing. My install also lost all my progress and I don‚Äôt really feel like playing it all again.

This is a great game and my go-to when I have a few minutes. However, on the endless mode, the difficulty really needs to change. Start easy then get harder. I don‚Äôt know why I can have up to 99 balls because it‚Äôs impossible to get far enough in endless to use that many. More levels would be great but I would really like to see the endless mode just get progressively more difficult rather than have blocks with 300 hits right off jump street.

title.label: Unable to turn off sound effects

content.label: It makes impossible to play while listening to a podcast or audio book.

title.label: Enjoyable but meh, not worth the price

content.label:
The play style of Holedown is solid! I love to aim the line at different angles and watch the onslaught of balls Ricochet off of everything, it‚Äôs satisfying! What‚Äôs not satisfying though is the 3 hours I spent going through the games worlds. They have an endless world however there is no sense to play because there is no variety in the abilities you purchase. Plus the boss battles at the end of each world are just the exact same boss but with a higher number to bring down to defeat it. Ugh! 
That‚Äôs lazy. You guys could‚Äôve made them different shapes, or have them move around or SOMETHING! Rather than the same circle of doom at the end of every level. This is definitely NOT worth $4 you all got greedy, this is a $.99 cent game up and down the board unless you have new worlds and abilities planned for the future. 
Shame really, because it feels really great to play, oh well.

title.label: Games great but has some technical issues

content.label:
I really do love this game but there are some things I‚Äôve noted that aren‚Äôt great

1. I couldn‚Äôt find a way to exit a level once it started. 

2. I beat the asteroid and have a core breached notification, but the same doesn‚Äôt happen after I beat the moon

3. Sometimes the ‚Äútutorial‚Äù with the ghost talking restarts after I open the game again

Fix these things and you‚Äôve got 5 stars easy
By far the best-feeling ballz like game I‚Äôve played. Wish there were more planets - gets boring in the endgame. Also - why can‚Äôt I toggle off the ball sounds???? It is maddening.

My addiction with this game is unhealthy; I should actually give it one star because I am now spending less time with my family. 
Please, for the love of all things holy...ADD MORE LEVELS!! 
Thank you.

Love the game. Beat the game. More levels please. 

Your loving customers,

Us

Definitely needs more levels or upgrades. If I can get all the upgrades after 3 hours of playing I don‚Äôt see where the money I paid for this app went. Maybe a 99 cent game. It‚Äôs very fun, but not enough levels/content before you hit the unlimited level. Bored already.

iCloud sync not working and the game gets boring fast

Refund requested

This is an amazing game, it‚Äôs incredibly simple, yet incredibly complex, I only have 3 problems, price is a little steep, 4 dollars is a lot for this kind of game, 2 dollars is more reasonable, you can only mute the music, you can‚Äôt mute the sound, and lastly, this is more of a bug, I lost my progress and had to start over, still fun tho
His game is really fun for about 5 hours then it suddenly stops being fun at the last level. No more upgrades and an endless unbeatable level left me disappointed.
This is a wonderful and addictive game. Kudos to the developers for that. Problem is for $4, there should be way more levels. You can finish this in a day..
Fun to play. Great sound. No in-app purchase nonsense. This is what iOS games should be.

title.label: Warning: Save Reset resets entire game without confirmation!

content.label: The game is entertaining enough, but two major issues: 1. The toggle that says ‚ÄúSave reset‚Äù? It deletes all of your progress without any warning! 2. The reason I tried toggling that was because I was looking for a way to quit out of a current round; turns out that there‚Äôs no way to do that.
Very fun, well made game. But short, very short. Too short for a $3.99 price tag. There is an endless mode once you beat the 6 short levels, but that just lazy game design.
Need more planets!
